tag.raw: dc:title=Travels through Virginia. From Theodor de Bry's 'America', Vol. I, 1590, after a drawing of John White

description._content: ID: 068524 Title: Travels through Virginia. From Theodor de Bry's 'America', Vol. I, 1590, after a drawing of John White Author: "Strachey, William (William Strachey)", "Bry, Theodor de (Theodor de Bry)" Illustrator: "White, John; Bry, Theodor de (John White; Theodor de Bry)", "Bry, Theodor de (Theodor de Bry)" Provenance: England; 1618 Caption: The idol Kivvasa. (Kiwasa). Engraving of an idol, Kivvasa, seated in a circular tent made from segments of woven cane or matting. The image has hair tied in a knot above the head, has a four-strand necklace of beads around the neck. It is wearing a close fitting jerkin, open at the front, and fringed skin apron-skirt. Language: English Source identifier: Sloane 1622, f.89 British Library Shelfmark: Sloane 1622 If you wish to purchase a high quality copy of this image, please place an order at Images Online imagesonline.bl.uk. The details from the above list should help you locate the images.
